title: Company Overview and Business Model
content:
## Tesla, Inc. (TSLA): Business Overview

### Executive Summary
Tesla, Inc. is a leading electric vehicle and clean energy company headquartered in Austin, Texas. 
Founded in 2003, the company has grown to employ approximately 140,000 people globally 
[Source: company_profile].

### Business Segments
The company operates through four main segments:
- **Automotive Sales** (78% of revenue): Core vehicle sales
- **Automotive Leasing** (7%): Vehicle leasing programs  
- **Energy Generation & Storage...

title: Financial Performance Analysis
content: ## Financial Performance Deep Dive ### Revenue Growth Revenue has grown at a 31.8% CAGR over the past 5 years, reaching $98.0B in 2024 [Source: income_statement]. However, growth has decelerated significantly from +71% in 2021 to +1% in 2024. @import "Revenue Growth Trend (2019-2024), bar chart with YoY growth annotations (income_statement)" ### Year-over-Year Performance | Year | Revenue ($B) | Yoy Growth | |---|---|---| | 2021 | $53.8 | +71.0% | | 2022 |...

title: Profitability Metrics Analysis
content:
## Profitability Analysis

### Margin Compression
Profitability has deteriorated significantly in 2023-2024:
- Gross Margin: 25.6% (2022) → 17.9% (2024)
- Operating Margin: 16.8% (2022) → 7.8% (2024)
- Net Margin: 15.5% (2022) → 7.2% (2024)

[Source: profitability_metrics]

@import "Profitability Margins Comparison (2019-2024), grouped bar chart showing gross and operating margins (profitability_metrics)"

### Margin Compression Drivers:
1. **Price Cuts**: Multiple price reductions averaging -15...

title: Vehicle Delivery Analysis
content: ## Vehicle Delivery Performance ### Annual Deliveries Tesla delivered approximately 1,800K vehicles in 2024, representing a -1% change YoY [Source: delivery_data]. @import "Annual Vehicle Deliveries (2019-2024), bar chart with trend line (delivery_data)" ### Delivery Trajectory | Year | Deliveries (K) | Yoy Growth | |---|---|---| | 2020 | $500.0 | +36.0% | | 2021 | $936.0 | +87.0% | | 2022 | $1.3K |

title: Competitive Landscape
content:
## Competitive Landscape Analysis

### Global EV Market Share
Tesla holds approximately 30% of the global EV market (among major players),
second to BYD at 42% [Source: competitor_data].

@import "Global EV Sales by Manufacturer (2024), bar chart comparing companies (competitor_data)"

| VW Group | $700.0 | $65.0 | 5.00x |

title: Balance Sheet Analysis
content:
## Balance Sheet Strength

### Financial Position
Tesla maintains a strong balance sheet with minimal leverage [Source: balance_sheet]:

### Financial Position

| Metric | Value |
|---|---|
| Total Assets | $106.6 |
| Cash & Equivalents | $26.1 |
| Total Debt | $5.7 |
| Shareholders' Equity | $62.8 |
| Current Ratio | 1.73x |
| Debt/Equity | 0.09x |

### Key Strengths:
1. **Net Cash Position**: $20.4B net cash
2. **Low Leverage**: D/E of 0.09x (minimal debt)

title: Valuation Analysis
content:

### Premium Analysis
Tesla trades at a significant premium to peers:
- **6.5x** the industry average P/E
- **5.5x** the industry average P/S
